page.title: 06 Religion in Wellow.
page.content: The Anglican church, which was built in 1216,has a Parish of 4500 people,100 of whom attend the Sunday services.The Rev.Brown conducts fifteen services a week,morning and evening prayer, and the sung eucharist on Sundays.The age of the congregation varies from six to sixty.St.Margaret's Church also has a choir. The Pentecostal church in Wellow is run by Rev.Tucker, who has a congregation of 25 people,whose ages vary greatly. The Methodist church is run by Rev.Smith and has a congregation of 25 of varying ages. Each of the above churches has a Sunday School and a Youth Fellowship.It is said that 3% of the population of Wellow go to church.There is also a Catholic church in Romsey. By Naomi Wreford,Alyson Buckle,Emma Lewis,Suzy Leigh.
